p: Binding free energy calculations for each complex were conducted by employing the MM/PBSA method. The Simeprevir–Mpro shows the highest average binding free energy of −77.44 ± 2.43 kcal/mol. All our selected drug–Mpro complexes demonstrate better binding free energy than the Remdesivir–Mpro complex ( Figure 4(f) ). The binding free energy of the Remdesivir–Mpro complex persisted as positive most of the time, which indicates loose binding between the drug and the protein. The binding free energy of Ergotamine–Mpro, Bromocriptine–Mpro, Tadalafil–Mpro and Lopinavir–Mpro complexes remained negative most of the time, which also indicates good binding ( Figure S2, supporting information). The average binding free energy was observed −26.33 ± 0.39, −33.69 ± 0.11, −14.46 ± 0.63, −0.31 ± 0.06 and −27.89 ± 0.35 kcal/mol for Ergotamine, Bromocriptine, Tadalafil, Remdesivir and Lopinavir, respectively.
